stead of
> > a bag of bagels, imagine a resource structured like a set of n=
esting
> > dolls, [1] each of which is individually addressable; and yet, t=
he

> =

Is defined to be hierarchical.

REST does not define URIs (styles do not =
define an architecture).
The URI spec does, and it reserves "/" to mean hie=
rarchical.

....Roy
